title: Feedback email flag removal from backoffice
description: feedback email flag is triggered for product feedback. Currently a flag is controlled in back office at SKU level to pass this into to CRMSince CRM already have logic on their end to filter products, its an overhead to maintain the flag in back officeso pls remove the flag from back office

ai.summary: Removal of feedback email flag from backoffice to reduce overhead as CRM already handles product filtering.
ai.doc_suggestion: Backoffice configuration and CRM integration documentation

title: Upload bulk option in back office for whitelisting phone numbers and agent codes
description: currently we don't have bulk upload option for whitelisting phone number and agent code. We are creating support tickets for L1 team. But the turn around time is high since it is a P3 request. So business user want a upload button in Backoffice under store creation tab. So that we can effective do whitelisting on our own.

ai.summary: Added bulk upload option for whitelisting phone numbers and agent codes in the back office under the store creation tab.
ai.doc_suggestion: Back office user guide, store creation section

title: incorrect error message for coupon exceed limit
description: when user enter a coupon exceeding the coupon limit count, then system shows correct error message in cart “ Cannot add 3 coupons on the cart” but on coupon section it shows “invalid coupon code” which is incorrect. both error message in cart and coupon section has to sync. please update the error message in coupon section as same as cart error message.Please note count is configurable in backoffice

ai.summary: Incorrect error message displayed in the coupon section when exceeding the coupon limit count

title: Make PAN entry mandatory for all payment greater than 2 Lakh
description: Government has made a rule for all ecommerce company to collect PAN card for bill amount greater than 2 Lakhs.Add it in payment section

ai.summary: Mandatory PAN entry for payments exceeding 2 Lakhs
ai.doc_suggestion: Payment processing and tax compliance documentation

title: Issue in inventory check logic
description: Reference order:#123456#789012There was 2 inventory available for SKU: ABC Partner created the cart with 2 units and successfully placed order.Order created and  2 units being soft allocated now net available inventory is 0 for SKU:ABCThink if partner not able to proceed payment due to payment page error. Now net available inventory becomes zero. so when partner again tries to place order partner cant since the inventory has become zero. Solution: Check inventory during order creation (to soft allocate) but do not check inventory at payment page during the time of partner payment

ai.summary: Inventory check logic fails to allow reordering when payment fails after soft allocation

title: Pre-reserve notification email template chnage
description: Due to new campaign we wish to make a small change in pre reserve email notification template.It has 2 new variable voucher code and price. Pls find the attached template

ai.summary: Updated pre-reserve notification email template to include new variables: voucher code and price.

title: Profile badge icon is  missing
description: Steps to recreate bugs1) login to app2) hover profile icon3) profile colour and icon is missing

ai.summary: Profile badge icon and color are missing when hovering over the profile icon in the app.

title: Ecommerce Purchase Journey
description: Ecommerce purchase journey from homepage ro order thank you page

ai.summary: Improvement in the e-commerce purchase journey flow from homepage to order thank you page

title: colour change for buy online pick in store orders
description: Add one more logic for BOPIS (buy online pick up in store) colour change. Apply all usual colour validation. On top of it only for BOPIS orders Check for inventory at the physical store not online inventory, if the physical store inventory is not available then colour change should not be allowed.

ai.summary: Added logic to prevent colour change for BOPIS orders if physical store inventory is unavailable.
ai.doc_suggestion: BOPIS order processing, colour validation, inventory check

title: Address section pincode should match with GST pincode
description: Need to add GST pincode validation in checkout page.Currently, we dont have any pincode check for delivery address section form and GST section form. We need to introduce same state pincode check for both address form section and GST form section. If same state pincode doesnt match then throw error “GST Pincode doesnt match with delivery address state’s pincode” and dont allow to proceed to payment section.

ai.summary: Added GST pincode validation to ensure matching pincodes between delivery address and GST sections during checkout.
ai.doc_suggestion: Checkout process, GST validation, address validation

title: Navigation incorrectly redirects to .txt file showing RSC payload when prefetch/router methods fail
description:
### Link to the code that reproduces this issue

https://github.com/azu/next-prefetch-txt-bug

### To Reproduce

Source Code: https://github.com/azu/next-prefetch-txt-bug

1. Open https://next-prefetch-txt-bug.vercel.app/ in your browser
3. Open Chrome DevTools and go to the Network tab
4. Click on "Normal Page Link (with prefetch)" to trigger initial prefetch
5. Block the request URL `https://next-prefetch-txt-bug.vercel.app/test-page.txt` in DevTools
6. Click the "Normal Page Link (with prefetch)" link again
7. Unexpectedly, the browser navigates to `/test-page.txt`

Video:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed697dbe-9dfd-452d-a61a-7bb2edf184a6

### Current vs. Expected behavior

**Expected behavior:**
- Navigation should go to `/test-page` and display the normal page component
- Users should see the rendered React page

**Actual behavior:**
- Instead of navigating to `/test-page`, the browser navigates to `/test-page.txt`
- The browser displays the raw RSC (React Server Component) payload code instead of the rendered page
- This happens when prefetch fails and the system falls back to hard navigation

This issue affects multiple navigation methods:
1. Next.js Link component with prefetch={true}
2. router.replace() and router.push() programmatic navigation

The problem appears to be that when these navigation methods fail and fall back to hard navigation, they incorrectly append `.txt` to the URL and serve the RSC payload instead of performing proper page navigation.

### Provide environment information

```bash
Operating System:
  Platform: darwin
  Arch: arm64
  Version: Darwin Kernel Version 24.5.0: Tue Apr 22 19:54:43 PDT 2025; root:xnu-11417.121.6~2/RELEASE_ARM64_T8132
  Available memory (MB): 32768
  Available CPU cores: 10
Binaries:
  Node: 22.18.0
  npm: 10.9.3
  Yarn: 1.22.21
  pnpm: 10.4.1
Relevant Packages:
  next: 15.4.5 // Latest available version is detected (15.4.5).
  eslint-config-next: N/A
  react: 19.1.0
  react-dom: 19.1.0
  typescript: 5.9.2
Next.js Config:
  output: export
```

### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

cacheComponents, Error Handling

### Which stage(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

next build (local), next start (local), Vercel (Deployed), Other (Deployed)

### Additional context

In Reproduce Step, I reproducing the issue using network blocks, but
in reality, when deploying a static site, we have encountered cases where the .txt file is changed, causing the retrieval of the .txt file to fail and the same issue to occur.
To summarize, we have encountered an issue where, after deployment, we are suddenly navigated to a URL such as `/path/to/page.txt`.


The issue stems from the URL mutation timing:

1. https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/46674 added MPA navigation fallback for failed RSC payload fetches
2. https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/75671 unintentionally moved the `.txt` extension logic to mutate the original `url` variable before the fetch attempt
3. When fetch fails, the fallback uses the mutated `url` with `.txt` extension and navigate it

ai.summary: Introduced a new enhancement to improve functionality.

title: Regression: next@15.4.3 - Browser back action with Page content not updating quickly as getting delay
description:
### Link to the code that reproduces this issue

https://github.com/SitharthanLearning/nextjs-browser-back-issue

### To Reproduce

1. Use Next.js 15.4.3 and sitecore-jss 22.8.0.
2. Create two pages:
     - A list/search page with client-side API fetching on search input.
     - A detail page navigated from the search results.
3. Navigate from the search page → detail page.
4. Press the browser Back button.
5. Observe the flickering or flash before the search page reappears.




### Current vs. Expected behavior

**Actual Behavior:**
Upon pressing the browser’s Back button:
    -Showing page content is still from previous route for 4 secs but current page url is correct.
**Expected Behavior:**
Upon pressing the browser’s Back button:
    -The URL and the visible content should both(pageUrl and pageContent) update immediately to match the previous route.
    -The page should restore the previous route without flickering and should be display relevant page content only.

### Provide environment information

```bash
Next.js Version: 15.4.3
sitecore-jss Version: 22.8.0
```

### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Loading UI and Streaming, Linking and Navigating

### Which stage(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Vercel (Deployed)

### Additional context

The upgrade was necessary due to a critical Wiz vulnerability in form-data@4.0.3, which was pulled via sitecore-jss.

We tried multiple workarounds, but the issue persists.
